ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Unnanounced change to level 40 cancel magic song?
ygData.msgSnippet: I think the reason you don t get a resist message is because Dispel-type effects can t be resisted (to my knowledge), i.e. there is no resist check for this
ygData.messageBody:
I think the reason you don't get a resist message is because Dispel-type
effects can't be resisted (to my knowledge), i.e. there is no resist check
for this type of spell. I have had dispel cast on me before with none of my
buffs being removed. I guess that could be what you would call the closest
thing to a resist. Otherwise I would treat dispels in the same manner as
Theft of Thought - your mana can't be stolen if you don't have any mana to
begin with.

Sartori{Legion}



>From: Reece Tom R CPT 25 ID L G4 <g4mntofcr@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@egroups.com
>To: EQBards <eqbards@egroups.com>
>Subject: [eqbards] Unnanounced change to level 40 cancel magic song?
>Date: Mon, 4 Dec 2000 09:14:28 -1000
>
>Haven't really used this song much on the past. The few times I did use
>it,
>I never noticed a successmessage that the song stuck or a resist message.
>The other night in Dreadlands a monk and I were partnered up so I memmed
>this song in case we pulled a spider. So first time I used it, I got the
>message "mob is surrounded by a static pulse of energy" or something else
>along those lines. So now it appears we get a success message when the
>song
>sticks.
>
>Galtin of E'ci
